definitions.definition: The process of developing; growth, directed change.
definitions.example: The development of this story has been slow.

definitions.definition: The process by which a mature multicellular organism or part of an organism is produced by the addition of new cells.
definitions.example: The organism has reached a crucial stage in its development.
Our news team brings you the latest developments.

definitions.definition: A project consisting of one or more commercial or residential buildings.
The building of such a project.
The application of new ideas to practical problems (cf. research).
definitions.example: Our development department has produced three new adhesives this year.

definitions.definition: The active placement of the pieces, or the process of achieving it.
definitions.example: White's development is good, but black's has been hampered by the pawn on e5.

definitions.definition: The process by in which previous material is transformed and restated.
The second section of a piece of music in sonata form, in which the original theme is revisited in altered and varying form.
The expression of a function in the form of a series.
